definition: the left-radical form of Kangxi radical 145, 衣[yi1]
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)
to mount a picture/also written 裱褙[biao3 bei4]

sentences.english: Regardless, a framed image is one of the easy ways to illicit an “awww.”
sentences.chinese: 但不管怎麼樣，裱相是一個贏得稱讚的最簡單的方法。

sentences.english: First, double-sided tape adhering to the cold laminating film being mounted on the back of map.
sentences.chinese: 首先要將雙面膠紙粘貼在被裱的冷裱膜圖的背面。

sentences.english: The rubbings are mounted in the Chinese way and have never been shown in China.
sentences.chinese: 拓片裱好以後，從此再沒有在中國展出。

sentences.english: The walls were pasted with wallpaper.
sentences.chinese: 這些牆壁是用壁紙裱的。

sentences.english: At one such altar sits a white shirt, protected in a glass frame.
sentences.chinese: 在一個祭壇上，放着一件被玻璃框裱起來的白襯衫。

definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
red ink paste used for seal
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey
